data.title: Collier Memorial State Park – Chiloquin, OR
data.meta_description: Rating: ⭐⭐⭐ Website: stateparks.oregon.gov Date/No. Nights: July-August 2023/3 nights Cost: $$ Site: B05 Hook-ups: Electric, water and sewer (All sites in B loop have FHU, some partial hookups in A loop) Site/Campground Description: Pull-through, asphalt, slightly unlevel, standard size site. Many mature pine trees throughout the campground with a some ground vegetation. Cell Service: Abundance…
data.text:
Rating: ⭐⭐⭐

Website: stateparks.oregon.gov

Date/No. Nights: July-August 2023/3 nights

Cost: $$

Site: B05

Hook-ups: Electric, water and sewer (All sites in B loop have FHU, some partial hookups in A loop)

Cell Service: Abundance of tall trees makes Starlink connection difficult. If you rely solely on Starlink, take this into consideration when choosing a site.

Laundry: No

Facilities/Amenities: Restrooms, Outdoor logging museum, hiking trails

Trash: Dumpsters located at exit beyond the camp host site

Pros: Inexpensive campground within short drive to Crater Lake National Park

Cons: Traffic noise from main highway, over half an hour drive to Klamath Falls for shopping/restaurants (basic needs can be found in nearby Chiloquin)
